title: Why does everyone think Vayne has horrible range?
body: Her range is 550, which is average ADC range... The first time I played her I thought she would have like 500 or 525 range since everyone kept saying how unsafe her laning phase is and how she has pretty short range. Is this just something that people say in order to defend Vayne and prevent nerfs hitting her?

replies.body:
Vayne has "short range" because she has no abilities which allow her to affect enemies outside of her autoattack range.

{{champion:22}} WR
{{champion:42}} QR
{{champion:51}} QR
{{champion:119}} ER
{{champion:81}} QWR
{{champion:104}} QR
{{champion:222}} WR
{{champion:429}} Q
{{champion:96}} QER
{{champion:236}} QWR (Targeting a minion)
{{champion:21}} QR (Bounce Q off a minion)
{{champion:133}} Q
{{champion:15}} QW
{{champion:6}} QE
{{champion:110}} QER

{{champion:18}} and {{champion:29}} are the only other ADCs who can't affect enemies outside of their autoattack range and both have abilities which can extend their autoattack range significantly.

You forgot Jinx's Q increases her AA range. 

Kalista's E can be cast from outside of AA range. 

I'm way too specific about this lol

For Kalista's E I forgot to factor in that a stack can be applied by her Q.

Jinx's Q I didn't include because it technically isn't allowing you to attack from beyond your autoattack range, it merely extends it.

But yeah, thanks.

Bingo. This right here.

Vayne is the only ADC not capable of hitting something besides AAs (aside from Trist, who gets range to compensate, and Twitch who also gets range, and has poison casks).

If she wants to hit someone, she has absolutely no choice whatsoever but to go into AA range and AA the enemy. THAT is why she is considered short ranged.

Okay...

Where did I suggest that Vayne get poke?
I think Graves' Q is the same (or very close) to his AA range.

Graves' Q will hit targets up to 950 units away while his autoattacks will hit targets up to 525 units.  It deals more damage when you are closer to the target, but it can still be used to poke and farm from a distance.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ekyukfgL,comment-id=000200060000,timestamp=2015-08-10T12:46:07.437+0000)
>
> Graves' Q will hit targets up to 950 units away while his autoattacks will hit targets up to 525 units.  It deals more damage when you are closer to the target, but it can still be used to poke and farm from a distance.

since the nerf of his Q, graves barrely does damage from a distance, if you do it you will just lose damage
Using it at long range isn't its optimal use, but it can still be used for poking and farming as desired.
"Barrely"? Was that a shotgun pun?
I was wrong then. Thanks for the correction, that looks really short-ranged.

ok, before we go any farther: urgot isn't a bot laner. he just isn't. he doesn't have the lategame tower seige (no attackspeed and short AA range). he's more like jayce, as a manamune-dependent mid. he starts out as this ad caster, then buys {{item:3110}} and other stuff to transition into a bulky armor shredder and pick-maker using his ult. also, graves' buckshot is actually more intended for closer range than even his auto-attacks for max damage, iirc.

Urgot can be played as a bot-lane champion.  It was quite popular a little while ago since he was durable enough to survive lockdown by multiple tanks while still dealing comparable damage to an ADC and had percentage armor reduction.  It's not overly popular, but it is perfectly viable.

Typically an Urgot build may look something like this:
{{item:3111}} {{item:3004}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3156}} 

Graves' Q deals more damage at close range but it still hits targets at 950 ranges, so he can use it to harass people beyond his autoattack range.

Switch that Randuin's with a Hexdrinker or a Banshee's and we got ourselves a deal. Urgot really just needs to survive burst damage and lockdown. If you were facing a heavy AD team, this would be acceptable, but usually there is more significant magic damage on a team than physical, making Hex and Banshee's much more appealing choices (possibly opting for Randuin's over Frozen Heart if you do not fear the AD threat very much).

Fixed.

Actually didn't notice I forgot to include MR.  Good catch; that probably is a more standard build, especially now that his shield scales with mana so you have more effective health.

You said what I was going to say, better than I was going to say it, she has no abilities which extend her range.

This topic gets brought up so often I just saved one of my old posts on it to Evernote.  Now I can just copy-and-paste everytime it comes up.

Quite convenient.

You forgot ADC Kennen

Although not nesssisarly meta he does have strong matchups against Vayne but when you realize that Vayne has the same range as Kennen, someone who used to have 575 until he was nerfed in season 3 then you really begin to scratch your head

I'd rather have ADC Kennen be cancer than Vayne

{{champion:85}} QWR

Other ADCs with 550 range have some sort of poke spells to compensate. Literally all of them. Don't believe me? Look it up. Sivir has a boomerang, Graves has Buckshot, etc etc etc.

However, her laning phase is weak, sure, but SAFE. She can safely farm because of her mobility and self peel.
{{champion:133}} has a trash tier poke spell and is 525 range.
Quinn's a great top laner though, and she can assassinate people. Her bird form gives her lots of mobility, and she has a blind. I do agree she needs buffs though.
An AOE blind is strong as John Cena's pecs. Why the hell are you poking with that?
Because it's suppose to justify her having worse range than vayne according the above poster by being poke.
She also has Vault, her dash, with 700 range.
Takes a target and is generally only same closing ability as tumble.

> [{quoted}](name=Kagami,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ekyukfgL,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-08-10T01:37:41.059+0000)
>
> {{champion:133}} has a trash tier poke spell and is 525 range.

Her poke is also a blind. Pretty nice against champs like vayne

> [{quoted}](name=Squidblimp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ekyukfgL,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-08-09T23:51:58.654+0000)

> 
> However, her laning phase is weak, sure, but SAFE. She can safely farm because of her mobility and self peel.

Expect Sivir and Graves dont have 550 range.

The point still remains that they have a means of poking from farther away than 550 range.
Vayne doesn't have this, she is maxed out at 550.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuroi86,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ekyukfgL,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-08-10T01:35:19.238+0000)
>
> The point still remains that they have a means of poking from farther away than 550 range.
> Vayne doesn't have this, she is maxed out at 550.

Yeah, but she makes it up by having one of the highest DPS while UNDER those 550 range. What, you want her to be able to poke the enemie and then all in you and kill you in 3 hits? No ty.

No, not by any means.
Vaynes lack of poke is the one thing which gives other ADC a fair chance in lane against her.
A good ADC can wreck Vayne early on using their poke, take that way and Vayne becomes season 1 Ashe.
She has nothing but that 550 range to fight from. Compared to other people with that range, they have some sort of extra distance poke or HUGE gap closers, or both.
Vayne has her Q, Thats a gap-closer.
"huge"
Tristana has one, and ez has a blink (which is much rarer)
Yeah it's also the size of a teemo while trist has that wall hop with resets which breaks some cc and ez has a BLINK (with cd reduction from q).
If you cant clear an average sized wall with the gap closer, it is by no means big, and definitely below average.
because auto attack range isnt the only thing that matters for ADCs their spells matter also shes the only ADC with average or worse range than most and doesnt have spells to help out
She can tumble 300 range which makes her 850 AA

she still puts herself in a position where she is targetable by doing so, as most cc/gapclosers have more than 550 range.
A cait pokeing with her Q is totally save.
lucian can dash 425 making his auto attack range 825. caitlyn can dash 400 range making her aa range 1050
500+425=925, not 825 for lucian

Vayne has nothing but a very small gap-closer to do anything outside of her AA range. Additionally, she has no way to increase her AA range (unlike Jinx, another hypercarry ADC). Due to this, she can get focused really easily in a fight and wiped out before she can destroy the enemies.

Unless you use point-and-click CC like Mao'kai or Naut. Also, if both ADCs are equally competent and both teams are equally competent then Vayne will most likely die before the other ADC in an otherwise equal fight, depending on the ADC.

Actually thinking when building teams lets you get reliable cc on your team easily. Vayne needs three hits to get all of her damage. Most adcs don't have this three hit spike and can easily crit her twice for all of her hp. In addition, vayne can't play the poke game when nearly every adc can.

Trist has more mobility and self peel than vayne.
